TopicTitle: How did you find the game?

Articles.Content: I was watching a Rise of Flight Video, and someone else posted a vid of two saturn Vs strapped together XD
December 2012 i was at Catalyst gaming and i saw someone say watch my stream and i started watching and i instantly knew i wanted to buy it so i did a month or so later.

Well, youtube kept recommending this guy called "Jacksepticeye", and i checked him out and subbed. at fist, i only watched turbo dismount, but then i checked his playlists and found one called "Kerbal Space Program" and checked it out.I watched and got a tiny bit interested, and then as i delved in into more ksp channels, i got more adiicted, and eventually, i found the popular ksp youtubers( Scott, Harv, Danny, etc) and thats when things really took off.i then bought the game, and ive been playing for three months now,a nd now i'm at the point where laythe is a piece of cake.
A guy in Wurm Online told me about it

saw someone playing the demo (steam version)

Then I decided that was interesting, and got addicted to the demo. When I bought the full version, it was shocking: much more content than the demo has. More fun. WOW.

bought it 0.21 and it was $24

How did I find the game??

Steady on, I haven't finished it yet, but I'm finding it rather good.

Alright, alright I do know what you mean...

Watched Nerdcubed's vid on it at about 10pm, by 4am I had completed HOCGaming's series on artificial gravity, Macey's SOK series *whistles mockingjay call* and had acheived orbit!
The Pirate Bay, it was really popular one time. Bought shortly after.
I saw KSP mentioned in thread on bodybuilding.com for the best games you've played.
Someone mentioned it in a comment to a youtube video of the 2013 Proton M launch failure - that made me curious.

Found it while searching for more sandbox spacegames after playing FTL, Ur-quan masters, Space Rangers 2, X series, Starlancer, Freelancer, Orbiter... You got the idea, I am sure.

Found it right when Mun just came to play.

Bought it half a year after that.
Saw discussions of the earlier versions ages ago, but I didn't get around to buying it until it was out on steam.

I watched prison architect letsplay from Mariocatgaming and he had a ksp letsplay too only 4 episodes i think

I think i had heard about it before but didnt know anything

After i saw him play i found it interresting (engineering,space,science,rockets how can that be not awsome) so searched a bit and found the demo

Startet it blew my first rocket and i was hooked

But i waited for a steam sale that was the astlroid update i think

And now i can call this the most unique and best gaming experience i had in a long time

KSP is realy special

Damn. This is going to be a really long story... So one day(2 YEARS ago), I decided to watch youtube and I was interested at "crashtastic" game and I found robbaz? or someone else playing it so I was watching that, and reccomendation section told me to watch a KSP video! (I think it was robbaz AGAIN(ALL HAIL HIM)) And after that, I got this game for 18 bucks on OFFICIAL SITE (I started when it was 0.17 it was that cheap back then XD) for my birthday present! Then... you know... MA LIFE HAS BE RE WRITTEN!!!!! (seriously it did. after playing this for 100hr or more... At least... Now I want to be a rocket engineer because of this game!)

Saw this, went to find the game.

http://xkcd.com/1244/

KSP was mentioned in many 'space' and 'failure' themed papers and forum threads, so when I stumbled on it on new year Steam sale, I decided to buy it, considered really low price at that moment. (it was discount, that lasted less then hour, may be even several minutes). It turned to be a great game.

Several of my youtube subscribers told me about this game that I should check out because they were certain I'd like it. I searched youtube for videos of it and found White Owl's first season in 0.13. After a few hours of watching that I got the 0.13.3 demo. The next day I started doing KSP videos, derping all over the place and making tons of n00b mistakes. A week or so later I had the cash and bought it, right around the time 0.16 came out. With Minecraft, I consider KSP one of the two best investment's I've ever made in games.
Found it on Kurtjmac's channel. Got the demo, then the full version a few days later.
